author: Dave and Deb
title: Our Top 4 Motorsport Experiences
text:
1 Comment » • Adrenaline Junkie , Luxury Travel , Travel Blog 
Daytona may have one of the longest sandy beaches in the world, but I think it is most well-known for the Daytona 500 . Known as the “Super Bowl” of stock car racing, the Daytona 500 is the biggest race on the schedule. Visitors can choose different motorsport experiences at the Daytona Speedway from touring the track to actually driving a race car. We signed up for a quick tour of the track giving us a behind the scenes sneak peak of the world famous raceway. Our 30 minute experience took us along pit row and into victory lane where we lined up to have our picture taken. We stood on the podium where champions like Dale Earnhardt Sr and Jr, Mario Andretti, and Richard Petty won their cups. Daytona Speedway Tours 
You can sign up for a 30 minute tour or take the expanded 90 minute VIP tour. Tours are quite reasonable starting at only $16 and the VIP only $50. Racing fans will love it . For more information on the speedway tours, and Richard Petty driving experience check out the Daytona 500 website . 
It was while sitting on a trolly with approximately 100 other people in the Florida heat that I started to think about all the other amazing motorsport experiences Dave and I have had around the world and it gave me an idea to round them up in a post. Top 4 Motorsport Experiences 1. Ferarri Driving Experience at Auto Dromo di Modena 
Our number 1 motorsport experience was having the chance to drive our own Ferrari at Auto Dromo di Modena in Emilia Romagna Italy. We had an instructor in the car with us telling us when to brake, when to shift gears and helping us out should we take a corner too fast. I have no idea what speeds we reached; I didn’t look at the speedometer – I was too excited to have my pedal to the metal feeling the power of the Ferrari. This was truly the ultimate motorsport experience and we can’t wait to drive another race car soon Read about the full experience at Fast Cars at La Modena Check out this motorsport experience in action: Subscribe to our YouTube Channel for Weekly Travel Videos Goodwood Stadium: Festival of Slow Driving Experience 
The Mongol Rally kicked off at Goodwood Stadium; a legendary Formula 1 racetrack famous for its annual Festival of Speed. Located 2 hours outside of London, England, it attracts the likes of Ferrari, Jaguar, Maserati, Mercedes and Porsche who race around the track at break-neck speeds. We had a bit of a different motorsport experience as we drove our tiny Nissan Almera packed with four adults and a ton of gear. This driving experience moved at approximately 10 km per hour! 
Known as The Festival of Slow it is the polar opposite of the Festival of Speed, but even though it was a slow ride, it wasn’t a dull ride. To actually be able to drive on this celebrated track was a thrill of a lifetime and we relished every slow mile of it. What an amazing way to kick off our 6 week drive across two continents and 15 countries! Read about this driving experience at Festival of Slow Check out our Mongol Rally Video! Meeting Fabio Lamborghini 
Emilia Romagna, Italy is known as the land of motorsports. The car companies Ducati, Ferrari and Lamborghini originated here. While we saw a lot of Ferraris and Ducatis during our travels in Italy, we only met one Lamborghini in person. Fabio Lamborghini is the nephew of Ferruccio Lamborghini, and he runs the family museum located in the town of Doso. We had the privilege of taking part in a private tour of the museum with Fabio and let me tell you, he is Fabulous! It was so much fun listening to his private stories about his famous uncle. The coolest thing was to see the toy cars that he got to play with. We had tonka trucks, he had functioning mini Lamborghinis to drive around on. 
It was a blast meeting Fabio Lamborghini and when we go back to Italy we’re going to look him up and see if we can do a Lamborghini Driving Expeirence next. Don’t think we can do it? Well, I have his card so you never know… Read more about our Fabio Lamborghini encounter at Meet Fabio Lambourghini VIPs at the Circuit de Catalunya 
Our very first real life motorsport experience just so happened to be a VIP experience at the Circuit de Catalunya. The Spanish Grand Prix takes part just outside Barcelona at this famous track and we got to watch it in style. We flashed our VIP badges upon entrance and had free reign of the back hallways as we joined the ranks of the ridiculously rich and famous for a day. Our all-access pass let us into the VIP area where we could sip champagne, enjoy fine food and explore every inch of the backstage. We witnessed the racing team’s staging areas and ultra luxurious motorhomes and then watched the race from the VIP owner’s boxes. It was truly out of this world. 
But that’s not all, after watching the race from the comfort of a box, we walked out to the centre of the track where we got to see the cars whizz by at extreme speeds. The VIP bleechers were empty as the grass and surrounding stands were packed with thousands of people. We watched the cars speed around the track as people catered to our every need and we said to ourselves, “So this is how the other half lives.” 
Read more about this motorsport experience at Our First F1 Race, The Catalunya Circuit Which Takes us back to the Daytona Speedway Daytona Speedway Experience I think had we had the chance to drive on the Daytona Speedway track it would have ranked higher. But sadly we didn’t get the chance to do it. However, if you go to Daytona and are a race car fan you should take part in the Richard Petty Driving Experience where you can either ride along as a passenger or drive yourself around the track. It’s definitely a bucket list item. Because of major renovations going on at the speedway it was only open on select days. 
For the price, the 30 minute speedway tour was pleasant and entertaining, and a good thing to do if you want to get away from the beach for awhile.It’s great for families too. One dad even carried his newborn around with him on the tour so clearly it’s perfect for all ages!
